Visual monitoring¶

Artists¶

class tasmania.plot.plot_monitors.Plot1d(grid, plot_function, field_to_plot, levels, interactive=True, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), tight_layout=True, plot_properties=None, plot_function_kwargs=None)¶
A sympl.Monitor visualizing a model state field along a line orthogonal to one of the coordinate planes.
interactive : bool
True to enable interactive plotting, False otherwise.
fontsize : int
Font size to use in the plot. Default is 16.
figsize : tuple
Tuple specifying the dimensions which the figure should have.
tight_layout : bool
True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise.
plot_properties : dict
Plot properties which are forwarded to and thereby set by set_plot_properties().
plot_function_kwargs : dict
Plot settings which are forwarded to the plot function as keywords arguments.
__init__(grid, plot_function, field_to_plot, levels, interactive=True, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), tight_layout=True, plot_properties=None, plot_function_kwargs=None)¶

The constructor.

grid : grid
The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
plot_function : function
Pointer to the function which pulls out of the state any quantity required to generate the plot, and generates the plot itself. The signature of this function should be fig, ax = plot_function(grid, state, field_to_plot, levels, fig, ax, **kwargs).
field_to_plot : str
String specifying the field to plot.
levels : dict
Dictionary whose keys are the ids of the two axes orthogonal to the cross line, and whose values are the corresponding indices identifying the cross line itself.
interactive : bool, optional
True to enable interactive plotting, False otherwise. Default is True.
fontsize : int, optional
Font size to use in the plot. Default is 16.
figsize : tuple, optional
Tuple specifying the dimensions which the figure should have. Default is (8, 8).

tight_layout : bool, optional

True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise. Default is True.

plot_properties : dict, optional
Plot properties which are forwarded and thereby set by set_plot_properties(). Default is None.
plot_function_kwargs : dict, optional
Plot settings which are forwarded to the plot function as keywords arguments. Default is None.
store(state, fig=None, ax=None, save_dest=None, show=False)¶

Update the plot using the given state.

Parameters:
  • state (dict) – A model state dictionary.
  • fig (figure, optional) – A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
  • ax (axes, optional) – An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes.
  • save_dest (str, optional) – Path to the location where the figure should be saved. The path should include the extension of the figure. If None or empty, the plot will not be saved.
  • show (bool, optional) – When the non-interactive mode is switched on, True to show the figure, False otherwise. Default is False.
Returns:

  • out_fig (figure) – The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
  • out_ax (axes) – The matplotlib.axes.Axes object enclosing the plot.
class tasmania.plot.plot_monitors.Plot2d(grid, plot_function, field_to_plot, level, interactive=True, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), projection=None, tight_layout=True, plot_properties=None, plot_function_kwargs=None)¶
A sympl.Monitor visualizing a model state field in a cross section parallel to one of the coordinate planes.
interactive : bool
True to enable interactive plotting, False otherwise.
fontsize : int
Font size to use in the plot. Default is 16.
figsize : tuple
Tuple specifying the dimensions which the figure should have.
projection : str, optional
Projection for the plot axes.
tight_layout : bool
True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise.
plot_properties : dict
Plot properties which are forwarded to and thereby set by set_plot_properties().
plot_function_kwargs : dict
Plot settings which are forwarded to the plot function as keywords arguments.
__init__(grid, plot_function, field_to_plot, level, interactive=True, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), projection=None, tight_layout=True, plot_properties=None, plot_function_kwargs=None)¶

The constructor.

plot_function : function
Pointer to the function which pulls out of the state any quantity required to generate the plot, and generates the plot itself. The signature of this function should be either fig = plot_function(grid, state, field_to_plot, x_level, fig, ax, **kwargs), fig = plot_function(grid, state, field_to_plot, y_level, fig, ax, **kwargs), or fig = plot_function(grid, state, field_to_plot, z_level, fig, ax, **kwargs).
grid : grid
The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
field_to_plot : str
String specifying the field to plot.
level : int
Either the i-index identifying the \(yz\)-cross-section, the j-index identifying the \(xz\)-cross-section, or the k-index identifying the \(xy\)-cross-section.
interactive : bool, optional
True to enable interactive plotting, False otherwise. Default is True.
fontsize : int, optional
Font size to use in the plot. Default is 16.
figsize : tuple, optional
Tuple specifying the dimensions which the figure should have. Default is (8, 8).
projection : str, optional
Projection for the plot axes. Default is None, i.e., the standard Cartesian projection is used.

tight_layout : bool, optional

True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise. Default is True.

plot_properties : dict, optional
Plot properties which are forwarded to and thereby set by set_plot_properties(). Default is None.
plot_function_kwargs : dict, optional
Plot settings which are forwarded to the plot function as keywords arguments. Default is None.
store(state, fig=None, ax=None, save_dest=None, show=False)¶

Update the plot using the given state.

Parameters:
  • state (dict) – A model state dictionary.
  • fig (figure) – A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
  • ax (axes) – An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes.
  • save_dest (str, optional) – Path to the location where the figure should be saved. The path should include the extension of the figure. If None or empty, the plot will not be saved.
  • show (bool, optional) – When the non-interactive mode is switched on, True to show the figure, False otherwise. Default is False.
Returns:

  • out_fig (figure) – The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
  • out_ax (axes) – The matplotlib.axes.Axes object enclosing the plot.
class tasmania.plot.plot_monitors.Plot3d(grid, plot_function, field_to_plot, interactive=True, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), projection='3d', tight_layout=True, plot_properties=None, plot_function_kwargs=None)¶
A sympl.Monitor visualizing a three-dimensional field. This class may be used, e.g., to plot the underlying topography.
interactive : bool
True to enable interactive plotting, False otherwise.
fontsize : int
Font size to use in the plot. Default is 16.
figsize : tuple
Tuple specifying the dimensions which the figure should have.
projection : str, optional
Projection for the plot axes.
tight_layout : bool
True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise.
plot_properties : dict
Plot properties which are forwarded to and thereby set by set_plot_properties().
plot_function_kwargs : dict
Plot settings which are forwarded to the plot function as keywords arguments.
__init__(grid, plot_function, field_to_plot, interactive=True, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), projection='3d', tight_layout=True, plot_properties=None, plot_function_kwargs=None)¶

The constructor.

plot_function : function
Pointer to the function which pulls out of the state any quantity required to generate the plot, and generates the plot itself. The signature of this function should be either fig = plot_function(grid, state, field_to_plot, y_level, fig, ax, **kwargs) or fig = plot_function(grid, state, field_to_plot, z_level, fig, ax, **kwargs).
grid : grid
The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
field_to_plot : str
String specifying the field to plot.
interactive : bool, optional
True to enable interactive plotting, False otherwise. Default is True.
fontsize : int, optional
Font size to use in the plot. Default is 16.
figsize : tuple, optional
Tuple specifying the dimensions which the figure should have. Default is (8, 8).
projection : str, optional
Projection for the plot axes. Default is ‘3d’.

tight_layout : bool, optional

True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise. Default is True.

plot_properties : dict, optional
Plot properties which are forwarded to and thereby set by set_plot_properties(). Default is None.
plot_function_kwargs : dict, optional
Plot settings which are forwarded to the plot function as keywords arguments. Default is None.
store(state, fig=None, ax=None, save_dest=None, show=False)¶

Update the plot using the given state.

Parameters:
  • state (dict) – A model state dictionary.
  • fig (figure) – A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
  • ax (axes) – An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes.
  • save_dest (str, optional) – Path to the location where the figure should be saved. The path should include the extension of the figure. If None or empty, the plot will not be saved.
  • show (bool, optional) – When the non-interactive mode is switched on, True to show the figure, False otherwise. Default is False.
Returns:

  • out_fig (figure) – The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
  • out_ax (axes) – The matplotlib.axes.Axes object enclosing the plot.

Plots overlapper and subplots assembler¶

class tasmania.plot.assemblers.PlotsOverlapper(artists, interactive=True, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), tight_layout=True, plot_properties=None)¶

This class creates a plot by merging the individual plots created by different artists. An artist may be either a Plot1d, Plot2d, or Plot3d object.

No consistency controls are performed on the list of artists. For instance, the composer does not check that all the artists use the same units for the axes. Ultimately, it is up to the user to ensure that everything is coherent.

interactive : bool
True to enable interactive plotting, False otherwise.
fontsize : int
The fontsize to be used.
figsize : tuple
The size which the figure should have.
tight_layout : bool
True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise.
plot_properties : dict
Plot properties which are forwarded to and thereby set by set_plot_properties().
__init__(artists, interactive=True, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), tight_layout=True, plot_properties=None)¶

The constructor.

artists : list
List of instances of either Plot1d or Plot1d.
interactive : bool, optional
True to enable interactive plotting, False otherwise. Default is True.
fontsize : int, optional
The fontsize to be used. Default is 16.
figsize : tuple, optional
The size which the figure should have. Default is (8, 8).

tight_layout : bool, optional

True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise. Default is True.

plot_properties : dict, optional
Plot properties which are forwarded to and thereby set by set_plot_properties(). Default is None.
projection¶

Return the projection used by the artists.

Returns:

The projection used by each artist.
Return type:

str
Raises:
  • RuntimeError : – If the artists use different projections.
  • AttributeError : – If the artists do not use any projection, i.e., if they are Plot1d objects.
store(states, fig=None, ax=None, save_dest=None, show=False)¶

Update the plot by invoking each artist on the corresponding state and properly merging the plots.

Parameters:
  • states (list) – List of dictionary model states. states[i] is forwarded to the i-th artist.
  • fig (figure, optional) – A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
  • ax (axes, optional) – An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes.
  • save_dest (str, optional) – Path to the location where the figure should be saved. The path should include the extension of the figure. If None or empty, the plot will not be saved.
  • show (bool, optional) – When the non-interactive mode is switched on, True to show the figure, False otherwise. Default is False.

Note

Figure titles and axes labels set by an artist do not overwrite the titles and labels set by any previous artist.

Returns:
  • out_fig (figure) – The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
  • out_ax (axes) – The matplotlib.axes.Axes enclosing the plot.
class tasmania.plot.assemblers.SubplotsAssembler(nrows, ncols, artists, interactive=True, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), tight_layout=True)¶
This class creates a visualization consisting of different subplots, with each subplot generated by a Plot1d, Plot2d, Plot3d, or PlotsOverlapper object.
artists : sequence
Sequence of Plot1d, Plot2d, Plot3d, or PlotsOverlapper objects.
interactive : bool
True to enable interactive plotting, False otherwise.
fontsize : int
The fontsize to be used.
figsize : tuple
The size which the figure should have.
tight_layout : bool
True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise.
__init__(nrows, ncols, artists, interactive=True, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), tight_layout=True)¶

The constructor.

nrows : int
Number of rows of the subplot grid.
ncols : int
Number of columns of the subplot grid.
artists : sequence
Sequence of Plot1d, Plot2d, Plot3d, or PlotsOverlapper objects.
interactive : bool, optional
True to enable interactive plotting, False otherwise. Default is True.
fontsize : int, optional
The fontsize to be used. Default is 16.
figsize : tuple, optional
The size which the figure should have. Default is (8, 8).

tight_layout : bool, optional

True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise. Default is True.

store(states, fig=None, save_dest=None, show=False)¶

Update the plot with the given list of states.

Parameters:
  • states (list) – List of dictionary model states. states[i] is forwarded to the i-th artist.
  • fig (figure, optional) – A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
  • save_dest (str, optional) – Path to the location where the figure should be saved. The path should include the extension of the figure. If None or empty, the plot will not be saved.
  • show (bool, optional) – When the non-interactive mode is switched on, True to show the figure, False otherwise. Default is False.
Returns:

out_fig – The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
Return type:

figure

Animation¶

class tasmania.plot.animation.Animation(artist, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), tight_layout=True, print_time=None, fps=15)¶
This class creates an animation by sequentially invoking a wrapped Plot1d, Plot2d, PlotsOverlapper, or SubplotsAssembler object on a list of model states, and grabbing the so-generated frames.
fontsize : int
The fontsize to be used.
figsize : tuple
The size which the figure should have.
tight_layout : bool
True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise.
print_time : str

String specifying if time should be printed above the plot, flush with the right edge. Options are:

  • ‘elapsed’, to print the time elapsed from the first snapshot stored;
  • ‘absolute’, to print the absolute time of the snapshot.
  • anything else, not to print anything.
fps : int
Frames per second.
__init__(artist, fontsize=16, figsize=(8, 8), tight_layout=True, print_time=None, fps=15)¶

The constructor.

artist : artist
Instance of Plot1d, Plot2d, PlotsOverlapper, or SubplotsAssembler.
fontsize : int, optional
The fontsize to be used. Default is 16.
figsize : tuple, optional
The size which the figure should have. Default is (8, 8).

tight_layout : bool, optional

True to fit plot to the figure, False otherwise. Default is True.

print_time : str

String specifying if time should be printed above the plot, flush with the right edge. Options are:

  • ‘elapsed’, to print the time elapsed from the first snapshot stored;
  • ‘absolute’, to print the absolute time of the snapshot.
  • anything else, not to print anything.

Default is None.

fps : int
Frames per second. Default is 15.
reset()¶

Empty the list of stored states.

run(save_dest)¶

Generate the animation based on the list of states stored in this object.

Parameters:save_dest (str) – Path to the location where the movie should be saved. The path should include the format extension.
store(states)¶

Append a new state (respectively, a list of states), to the list of states (resp., lists of states) stored in this object.

Parameters:states (dict or list) – A model state dictionary, or a list of model state dictionaries.

Plot functions¶

1-D plot functions¶

tasmania.plot.profile_1d.plot_horizontal_profile(grid, state, field_to_plot, levels, fig, ax, **kwargs)¶

Given an input model state, visualize a specified field along a line orthogonal to either the \(xz\)- or \(yz\)-plane. In the plot, the spatial coordinate is on the x-axis, while the field goes on the y-axis.

Parameters:
  • grid (computational grid) – The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
  • state (dict) – A model state dictionary.
  • field_to_plot (str) –

    String specifying the field to plot. This might be:

    • the name of a variable stored in the input model state.
  • levels (dict) – Dictionary whose keys are the ids of the two axes orthogonal to the cross line, and whose values are the corresponding indices identifying the cross line itself. Note that one of the keys must necessarily be 2.
  • fig (figure) – A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
  • ax (axes) – An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments specifying different plotting settings. See plot_xy() for the complete list.
Returns:

  • fig (figure) – The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
  • ax (axes) – The matplotlib.axes.Axes enclosing the plot.
Raises:
  • ValueError : – If the length of levels is not 2.
  • KeyError : – If levels does not contain the key 2.
tasmania.plot.profile_1d.plot_vertical_profile(grid, state, field_to_plot, levels, fig, ax, **kwargs)¶

Given an input model state, visualize a specified field along a vertical line, i.e., a line orthogonal to the \(xy\)-plane. In the plot, the field is on the x-axis, while the vertical, possibly terrain-following coordinate goes on the y-axis.

Parameters:
  • grid (computational grid) – The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
  • state (dict) – A model state dictionary.
  • field_to_plot (str) –

    String specifying the field to plot. This might be:

    • the name of a variable stored in the input model state.
  • levels (dict) – Dictionary whose keys are the ids of the two axes orthogonal to the cross line, and whose values are the corresponding indices identifying the cross line itself. Note that the keys must necessarily be 0 and 1.
  • fig (figure) – A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
  • ax (axes) – An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments specifying different plotting settings. See plot_xy() for the complete list.
Returns:

  • fig (figure) – The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
  • ax (axes) – The matplotlib.axes.Axes enclosing the plot.
Raises:
  • ValueError : – If the length of levels is not 2.
  • KeyError : – If levels does not contain the keys 0 and 1.
tasmania.plot.profile_1d.plot_vertical_profile_with_respect_to_vertical_height(grid, state, field_to_plot, levels, fig, ax, **kwargs)¶

Given an input model state, visualize a specified field along a vertical line, i.e., a line orthogonal to the \(xy\)-plane. In the plot, the field is on the x-axis, while the geometric height above the terrain goes on the y-axis.

Parameters:
  • grid (computational grid) – The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
  • state (dict) – A model state dictionary.
  • field_to_plot (str) –

    String specifying the field to plot. This might be:

    • the name of a variable stored in the input model state.
  • levels (dict) – Dictionary whose keys are the ids of the two axes orthogonal to the cross line, and whose values are the corresponding indices identifying the cross line itself. Note that the keys must necessarily be 0 and 1.
  • fig (figure, optional) – A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
  • ax (axes, optional) – An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments to specify different plotting settings. See plot_xy() for the complete list.
Returns:

  • fig (figure) – The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
  • ax (axes) – The matplotlib.axes.Axes enclosing the plot.

Note

Either the grid or the model state must contain height or height_on_interface_levels.

Raises:
  • ValueError : – If the length of levels is not 2.
  • KeyError : – If levels does not contain the keys 0 and 1.

2-D plot functions¶

tasmania.plot.contour_xz.make_contour_xz(grid, state, field_to_plot, y_level, fig, ax, **kwargs)¶

Given an input model state, generate the contour plot of a specified field at a cross-section parallel to the \(xz\)-plane.

Parameters:
  • grid (grid) – The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
  • state (dict) – A model state dictionary.
  • field_to_plot (str) –

    String specifying the field to plot. This might be:

    • the name of a variable stored in the input model state;
    • ’vertical_velocity’, for the vertical velocity of a two-dimensional, steady-state, isentropic flow; the model state should contain the following variables:
      • air_isentropic_density;
      • x_momentum_isentropic;
      • height_on_interface_levels.
  • y_level (int) – \(y\)-index identifying the cross-section.
  • fig (figure) – A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
  • ax (axes) – An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments specifying different plotting settings. See plot_contour_xz() for the complete list.
Returns:

  • out_fig (figure) – The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
  • out_ax (axes) – The matplotlib.axes.Axes enclosing the plot.
Raises:

ValueError : – If neither the grid, nor the model state, contains height or height_on_interface_levels.
tasmania.plot.contourf_xy.make_contourf_xy(grid, state, field_to_plot, z_level, fig, ax, **kwargs)¶

Given an input model state, generate the contourf plot of a specified field at a cross-section parallel to the \(xy\)-plane.

grid : grid
The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
state : dict
A model state dictionary.
field_to_plot : str

String specifying the field to plot. This might be:

  • the name of a variable stored in the input model state;

  • ‘horizontal_velocity’, for the horizontal velocity; the current object must contain either:

    • x_velocity and y_velocity;
    • x_velocity_at_u_locations and y_velocity_at_v_locations;
    • air_density, x_momentum, and y_momentum;
    • air_isentropic_density, x_momentum_isentropic, and y_momentum_isentropic.
z_level : int
\(z\)-index identifying the cross-section.
fig : figure
A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
ax : axes

An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes. **kwargs :

Keyword arguments specifying different plotting settings. See plot_contourf_xy() for the complete list.
fig : figure
The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
ax : axes
The matplotlib.axes.Axes enclosing the plot.
tasmania.plot.contourf_xz.make_contourf_xz(grid, state, field_to_plot, y_level, fig, ax, **kwargs)¶

Given an input model state, generate the contourf plot of a specified field at a cross-section parallel to the \(xz\)-plane.

Parameters:
  • grid (grid) – The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
  • state (dict) – A model state dictionary.
  • field_to_plot (str) –

    String specifying the field to plot. This might be:

    • the name of a variable stored in the input model state;
    • ’vertical_velocity’, for the vertical velocity of a two-dimensional, steady-state, isentropic flow; the model state should contain the following variables:
      • air_isentropic_density;
      • x_momentum_isentropic;
      • height_on_interface_levels.
  • y_level (int) – \(y\)-index identifying the cross-section.
  • fig (figure) – A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
  • ax (axes) – An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes.
  • **kwargs – Keyword arguments specifying different plotting settings. See plot_contourf_xz() for the complete list.
Returns:

  • fig (figure) – The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
  • ax (axes) – The matplotlib.axes.Axes enclosing the plot.
Raises:

ValueError : – If neither the grid, nor the model state, contains height nor height_on_interface_levels.
tasmania.plot.quiver_xy.make_quiver_xy(grid, state, field_to_plot, z_level, fig, ax, **kwargs)¶

Generate the quiver plot of a vector field at a cross section parallel to the \(xy\)-plane.

grid : grid
The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
state : dict
A model state dictionary.
field_to_plot : str

String specifying the field to plot. This might be:

  • ‘horizontal_velocity’, for the horizontal velocity; the current object must contain either:

    • x_velocity and y_velocity;
    • x_velocity_at_u_locations and y_velocity_at_v_locations;
    • air_density, x_momentum, and y_momentum;
    • air_isentropic_density, x_momentum_isentropic, and y_momentum_isentropic.
z_level : int
\(z\)-level identifying the cross-section.
fig : figure
A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
ax : axes

An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes. **kwargs :

Keyword arguments specifying different plotting settings. See plot_quiver_xy() for the complete list.
fig : figure
The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
ax : axes
The matplotlib.axes.Axes enclosing the plot.

3-D plot functions¶

tasmania.plot.topography.plot_topography_3d(grid, state=None, field_to_plot='topography', fig=None, ax=None, **kwargs)¶

An utility to visualize a three-dimensional orography using the mplot3d toolkit.

grid : grid
The underlying grid, as an instance of GridXYZ, or one of its derived classes.
state : dict, optional
A model state dictionary.
field_to_plot : str
String specifying the field to plot.
fig : figure, optional
A matplotlib.pyplot.figure.
ax : axes, optional
An instance of matplotlib.axes.Axes.
fontsize : int
The fontsize to be used. Default is 12.
figsize : sequence
Sequence representing the figure size. Default is [8,8]. This argument is effective only if the figure is instantiated within the function, i.e., if both the fig and ax arguments are not given
x_factor : float
Scaling factor for the \(x\)-axis. Default is 1.
y_factor : float
Scaling factor for the \(y\)-axis. Default is 1.
z_factor : float

Scaling factor for the topography. Default is 1. draw_grid : bool

True to draw the underlying grid, False otherwise. Default is True.
cbar_on : bool
True to show the color bar, False otherwise. Default is True.
cmap_name : str
Name of the Matplotlib’s color map to be used. All the color maps provided by Matplotlib, as well as the corresponding inverted versions, are available.
cbar_levels : int
Number of levels for the color bar. Default is 14.
cbar_ticks_step : int
Distance between two consecutive labelled ticks of the color bar. Default is 1, i.e., all ticks are displayed with the corresponding label.
cbar_ticks_pos : str
‘center’ to place the color bar ticks in the middle of the color intervals, anything else to place the ticks at the interfaces between color intervals.
cbar_center : float
Center of the range covered by the color bar. By default, the color bar covers the spectrum ranging from the minimum to the maximum assumed by the field.
cbar_half_width : float
Half-width of the range covered by the color bar. By default, the color bar covers the spectrum ranging from the minimum to the maximum assumed by the field.
cbar_x_label : str
Label for the horizontal axis of the color bar. Default is an empty string.
cbar_y_label : str
Label for the vertical axis of the color bar. Default is an empty string.
cbar_orientation : str
Orientation of the color bar. Either ‘vertical’ (default) or ‘horizontal’.
cbar_ax : tuple
Indices of the figure axes from which space for the color bar axes is stolen. If multiple indices are given, the corresponding axes are all evenly resized to make room for the color bar. By default, only the current axes are resized.

The arguments state and field_to_plot are dummy parameters, i.e., they get not used by the function. Nevertheless, they are retained in the function signature for compliancy with Plot3d

fig : figure
The matplotlib.pyplot.figure containing the plot.
ax : axes
The matplotlib.axes.Axes enclosing the plot.
